1→import type { ComposerTranslation } from 'vue-i18n'
     2→import type { $ZodType } from 'zod/v4/core'
     3→
     4→import type { ProviderDefinition } from '../types'
     5→
     6→import { orderBy } from 'es-toolkit'
     7→
     8→const providerRegistry = new Map<string, ProviderDefinition>()
     9→
    10→export function listProviders(): ProviderDefinition[] {
    11→  const providerDefs = Array.from(providerRegistry.values()).map(def => ({ order: 99999, ...def }))
    12→  const sorted = orderBy(providerDefs, [p => p.order, 'name'], ['asc', 'asc'])
    13→  return sorted
    14→}
    15→
    16→export function getDefinedProvider(id: string): ProviderDefinition | undefined {
    17→  return providerRegistry.get(id)
    18→}
    19→
    20→export function defineProvider<T>(definition: { createProviderConfig: (contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => $ZodType<T> } & ProviderDefinition<T>): ProviderDefinition<T> {
    21→  const provider = {
    22→    ...definition,
    23→  }
    24→
    25→  providerRegistry.set(definition.id, definition)
    26→
    27→  return provider
    28→}
    29→

1→import { createOllama } from '@xsai-ext/providers/create'
     2→import { z } from 'zod'
     3→
     4→import { createOpenAICompatibleValidators } from '../../validators'
     5→import { defineProvider } from '../registry'
     6→
     7→export const providerOllama = defineProvider({
     8→  id: 'ollama',
     9→  order: 2,
    10→  name: 'Ollama',
    11→  nameLocalize: ({ t }) => t('settings.pages.providers.provider.ollama.title'),
    12→  description: 'Local Ollama server for fast model iteration.',
    13→  descriptionLocalize: ({ t }) => t('settings.pages.providers.provider.ollama.description'),
    14→  tasks: ['chat'],
    15→  icon: 'i-lobe-icons:ollama',
    16→
    17→  createProviderConfig: ({ t }) => z.object({
    18→    baseUrl: z.string()
    19→      .default('http://localhost:11434/v1/')
    20→      .meta({
    21→        labelLocalized: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.config.common.fields.field.base-url.label'),
    22→        descriptionLocalized: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.config.common.fields.field.base-url.description'),
    23→        placeholderLocalized: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.config.common.fields.field.base-url.placeholder'),
    24→      }),
    25→    headers: z.record(z.string(), z.string())
    26→      .optional()
    27→      .meta({
    28→        labelLocalized: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.config.common.fields.field.headers.label'),
    29→        descriptionLocalized: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.config.common.fields.field.headers.description'),
    30→        section: 'advanced',
    31→        type: 'key-values',
    32→      }),
    33→  }),
    34→  createProvider(config) {
    35→    return createOllama('', config.baseUrl)
    36→  },
    37→  validationRequiredWhen: () => true,
    38→  validators: {
    39→    validateConfig: [
    40→      ({ t }) => ({
    41→        id: 'ollama:check-config',
    42→        name: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.validators.openai-compatible.check-config.title'),
    43→        validator: async (config) => {
    44→          const errors: Array<{ error: unknown }> = []
    45→          const baseUrl = typeof config.baseUrl === 'string' ? config.baseUrl.trim() : ''
    46→
    47→          if (!baseUrl)
    48→            errors.push({ error: new Error('Base URL is required.') })
    49→
    50→          if (baseUrl) {
    51→            try {
    52→              const parsed = new URL(baseUrl)
    53→              if (!parsed.host)
    54→                errors.push({ error: new Error('Base URL is not absolute. Check your input.') })
    55→            }
    56→            catch {
    57→              errors.push({ error: new Error('Base URL is invalid. It must be an absolute URL.') })
    58→            }
    59→          }
    60→
    61→          return {
    62→            errors,
    63→            reason: errors.length > 0 ? errors.map(item => (item.error as Error).message).join(', ') : '',
    64→            reasonKey: '',
    65→            valid: errors.length === 0,
    66→          }
    67→        },
    68→      }),
    69→    ],
    70→    validateProvider: createOpenAICompatibleValidators({
    71→      checks: ['connectivity', 'model_list', 'chat_completions'],
    72→    })!.validateProvider,
    73→  },
    74→  business: ({ t }) => ({
    75→    troubleshooting: {
    76→      validators: {
    77→        openaiCompatibleCheckConnectivity: {
    78→          label: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.providers.provider.ollama.troubleshooting.validators.openai-compatible-check-connectivity.label'),
    79→          content: t('settings.pages.providers.catalog.edit.providers.provider.ollama.troubleshooting.validators.openai-compatible-check-connectivity.content'),
    80→        },
    81→      },
    82→    },
    83→  }),
    84→})
    85→

1→import type {
     2→  ChatProvider,
     3→  ChatProviderWithExtraOptions,
     4→  EmbedProvider,
     5→  EmbedProviderWithExtraOptions,
     6→  ModelProvider,
     7→  ModelProviderWithExtraOptions,
     8→  SpeechProvider,
     9→  SpeechProviderWithExtraOptions,
    10→  TranscriptionProvider,
    11→  TranscriptionProviderWithExtraOptions,
    12→} from '@xsai-ext/providers/utils'
    13→import type { ProgressInfo } from '@xsai-transformers/shared/types'
    14→import type { MaybePromise } from 'clustr'
    15→import type { ComposerTranslation } from 'vue-i18n'
    16→import type { $ZodType } from 'zod/v4/core'
    17→
    18→export type ProviderInstance
    19→  = | ChatProvider
    20→    | ChatProviderWithExtraOptions
    21→    | EmbedProvider
    22→    | EmbedProviderWithExtraOptions
    23→    | SpeechProvider
    24→    | SpeechProviderWithExtraOptions
    25→    | TranscriptionProvider
    26→    | TranscriptionProviderWithExtraOptions
    27→    | ModelProvider
    28→    | ModelProviderWithExtraOptions
    29→
    30→export function isModelProvider(providerInstance: ProviderInstance): providerInstance is ModelProvider | ModelProviderWithExtraOptions {
    31→  if ('model' in providerInstance && typeof providerInstance.model === 'function') {
    32→    return true
    33→  }
    34→
    35→  return false
    36→}
    37→
    38→export interface ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig> {
    39→  listModels?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance) => Promise<ModelInfo[]>
    40→  listVoices?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance) => Promise<VoiceInfo[]>
    41→  loadModel?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance, hooks?: { onProgress?: (progress: ProgressInfo) => Promise<void> | void }) => Promise<void>
    42→}
    43→
    44→export interface ProviderValidationResult {
    45→  errors: Array<{ error: unknown, errorKey?: string }>
    46→  reason: string
    47→  reasonKey: string
    48→  valid: boolean
    49→}
    50→
    51→export interface ModelInfo {
    52→  id: string
    53→  name: string
    54→  provider: string
    55→  description?: string
    56→  capabilities?: string[]
    57→  contextLength?: number
    58→  deprecated?: boolean
    59→}
    60→
    61→export interface VoiceInfo {
    62→  id: string
    63→  name: string
    64→  provider: string
    65→  compatibleModels?: string[]
    66→  description?: string
    67→  gender?: string
    68→  deprecated?: boolean
    69→  previewURL?: string
    70→  languages: {
    71→    code: string
    72→    title: string
    73→  }[]
    74→}
    75→
    76→// eslint-disable-next-line ts/no-unnecessary-type-constraint
    77→export interface ProviderDefinition<TConfig extends any = any> {
    78→  id: string
    79→  order?: number
    80→  tasks: string[]
    81→  nameLocalize: (ctx: { t: (input: string) => string }) => string // i18n key for provider name
    82→  name: string // Default name (fallback)
    83→  descriptionLocalize: (ctx: { t: (input: string) => string }) => string // i18n key for provider description
    84→  description: string // Default description (fallback)
    85→  /**
    86→   * Iconify JSON icon name for the provider.
    87→   *
    88→   * Icons are available for most of the AI provides under @proj-airi/lobe-icons.
    89→   */
    90→  icon?: string
    91→  iconColor?: string
    92→  /**
    93→   * In case of having image instead of icon, you can specify the image URL here.
    94→   */
    95→  iconImage?: string
    96→
    97→  /**
    98→   * Indicates whether the provider is available.
    99→   * If not specified, the provider is always available.
   100→   *
   101→   * May be specified when any of the following criteria is required:
   102→   *
   103→   * Platform requirements:
   104→   *
   105→   * - app-* providers are only available on desktop, this is responsible for Tauri runtime checks
   106→   * - web-* providers are only available on web, this means Node.js and Tauri should not be imported or used
   107→   *
   108→   * System spec requirements:
   109→   *
   110→   * - may requires WebGPU / NVIDIA / other types of GPU,
   111→   *   on Web, WebGPU will automatically compiled to use targeting GPU hardware
   112→   * - may requires significant amount of GPU memory to run, especially for
   113→   *   using of small language models within browser or Tauri app
   114→   * - may requires significant amount of memory to run, especially for those
   115→   *   non-WebGPU supported environments.
   116→   */
   117→  isAvailableBy?: () => Promise<boolean> | boolean
   118→
   119→  createProviderConfig: (contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => $ZodType<TConfig>
   120→  createProvider: (config: TConfig) => ProviderInstance
   121→  extraMethods?: ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig>
   122→  validationRequiredWhen?: (config: TConfig) => boolean
   123→  validators?: {
   124→    validateConfig?: Array<(contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => { id: string, name: string, validator: (config: TConfig, contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => MaybePromise<ProviderValidationResult> }>
   125→    validateProvider?: Array<(contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => { id: string, name: string, validator: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance, providerExtra: ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig>, contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => MaybePromise<ProviderValidationResult> }>
   126→  }
   127→  capabilities?: {
   128→    transcription?: {
   129→      protocol: 'websocket' | 'http'
   130→      generateOutput: boolean
   131→      streamOutput: boolean
   132→      streamInput: boolean

import type {
  ChatProvider,
  ChatProviderWithExtraOptions,
  EmbedProvider,
  EmbedProviderWithExtraOptions,
  ModelProvider,
  ModelProviderWithExtraOptions,
  SpeechProvider,
  SpeechProviderWithExtraOptions,
  TranscriptionProvider,
  TranscriptionProviderWithExtraOptions,
} from '@xsai-ext/providers/utils'
import type { ProgressInfo } from '@xsai-transformers/shared/types'
import type { MaybePromise } from 'clustr'
import type { ComposerTranslation } from 'vue-i18n'
import type { $ZodType } from 'zod/v4/core'

export type ProviderInstance
  = | ChatProvider
    | ChatProviderWithExtraOptions
    | EmbedProvider
    | EmbedProviderWithExtraOptions
    | SpeechProvider
    | SpeechProviderWithExtraOptions
    | TranscriptionProvider
    | TranscriptionProviderWithExtraOptions
    | ModelProvider
    | ModelProviderWithExtraOptions

export function isModelProvider(providerInstance: ProviderInstance): providerInstance is ModelProvider | ModelProviderWithExtraOptions {
  if ('model' in providerInstance && typeof providerInstance.model === 'function') {
    return true
  }

  return false
}

export interface ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig> {
  listModels?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance) => Promise<ModelInfo[]>
  listVoices?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance) => Promise<VoiceInfo[]>
  loadModel?: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance, hooks?: { onProgress?: (progress: ProgressInfo) => Promise<void> | void }) => Promise<void>
}

export interface ProviderValidationResult {
  errors: Array<{ error: unknown, errorKey?: string }>
  reason: string
  reasonKey: string
  valid: boolean
}

export interface ModelInfo {
  id: string
  name: string
  provider: string
  description?: string
  capabilities?: string[]
  contextLength?: number
  deprecated?: boolean
}

export interface VoiceInfo {
  id: string
  name: string
  provider: string
  compatibleModels?: string[]
  description?: string
  gender?: string
  deprecated?: boolean
  previewURL?: string
  languages: {
    code: string
    title: string
  }[]
}

// eslint-disable-next-line ts/no-unnecessary-type-constraint
export interface ProviderDefinition<TConfig extends any = any> {
  id: string
  order?: number
  tasks: string[]
  nameLocalize: (ctx: { t: (input: string) => string }) => string // i18n key for provider name
  name: string // Default name (fallback)
  descriptionLocalize: (ctx: { t: (input: string) => string }) => string // i18n key for provider description
  description: string // Default description (fallback)
  /**
   * Iconify JSON icon name for the provider.
   *
   * Icons are available for most of the AI provides under @proj-airi/lobe-icons.
   */
  icon?: string
  iconColor?: string
  /**
   * In case of having image instead of icon, you can specify the image URL here.
   */
  iconImage?: string

  /**
   * Indicates whether the provider is available.
   * If not specified, the provider is always available.
   *
   * May be specified when any of the following criteria is required:
   *
   * Platform requirements:
   *
   * - app-* providers are only available on desktop, this is responsible for Tauri runtime checks
   * - web-* providers are only available on web, this means Node.js and Tauri should not be imported or used
   *
   * System spec requirements:
   *
   * - may requires WebGPU / NVIDIA / other types of GPU,
   *   on Web, WebGPU will automatically compiled to use targeting GPU hardware
   * - may requires significant amount of GPU memory to run, especially for
   *   using of small language models within browser or Tauri app
   * - may requires significant amount of memory to run, especially for those
   *   non-WebGPU supported environments.
   */
  isAvailableBy?: () => Promise<boolean> | boolean

  createProviderConfig: (contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => $ZodType<TConfig>
  createProvider: (config: TConfig) => ProviderInstance
  extraMethods?: ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig>
  validationRequiredWhen?: (config: TConfig) => boolean
  validators?: {
    validateConfig?: Array<(contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => { id: string, name: string, validator: (config: TConfig, contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => MaybePromise<ProviderValidationResult> }>
    validateProvider?: Array<(contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => { id: string, name: string, validator: (config: TConfig, provider: ProviderInstance, providerExtra: ProviderExtraMethods<TConfig>, contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => MaybePromise<ProviderValidationResult> }>
  }
  capabilities?: {
    transcription?: {
      protocol: 'websocket' | 'http'
      generateOutput: boolean
      streamOutput: boolean
      streamInput: boolean
    }
  }
  business?: (contextOptions: { t: ComposerTranslation }) => {
    troubleshooting?: {
      validators?: {
        openaiCompatibleCheckConnectivity?: {
          label?: string
          content?: string
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Based on the provided documentation, **the page does not contain information about OpenClaw's API specifications, endpoints, or authentication methods**.

The documentation covers:
- Installation and setup procedures
- Gateway architecture and multi-channel support
- Configuration through JSON files
- Features like multi-agent routing and media support

However, it does **not discuss**:
- REST API endpoints or base URLs
- OpenAI compatibility
- Chat completion endpoints
- Authentication schemes (API keys, bearer tokens)
- WebSocket availability

To find this technical information, you would need to consult the complete documentation index referenced at the beginning: https://docs.openclaw.ai/llms.txt, or explore additional pages in the docs covering API specifications and integration details.

1→import messages from '@proj-airi/i18n/locales'
     2→
     3→import { createI18n } from 'vue-i18n'
     4→
     5→const languageRemap: Record<string, string> = {
     6→  'zh-CN': 'zh-Hans',
     7→  'zh-TW': 'zh-Hans', // TODO: remove this when zh-Hant is supported
     8→  'zh-HK': 'zh-Hans', // TODO: remove this when zh-Hant is supported
     9→  'zh-Hant': 'zh-Hans', // TODO: remove this when zh-Hant is supported
    10→  'en-US': 'en',
    11→  'en-GB': 'en',
    12→  'en-AU': 'en',
    13→  'en': 'en',
    14→  'es-ES': 'es',
    15→  'es-MX': 'es',
    16→  'es-AR': 'es',
    17→  'es': 'es',
    18→  'ru': 'ru',
    19→  'ru-RU': 'ru',
    20→  'fr': 'fr',
    21→  'fr-FR': 'fr',
    22→}
    23→
    24→function getLocale() {
    25→  let language = localStorage.getItem('settings/language')
    26→  const languages = Object.keys(messages!)
    27→
    28→  if (languageRemap[language || 'en'] != null) {
    29→    language = languageRemap[language || 'en']
    30→  }
    31→  if (language && languages.includes(language))
    32→    return language
    33→
    34→  return 'en'
    35→}
    36→
    37→export const i18n = createI18n({
    38→  legacy: false,
    39→  locale: getLocale(),
    40→  fallbackLocale: 'en',
    41→  messages,
    42→})

content.content:
# OpenClaw Documentation Overview

## Documentation Categories

OpenClaw maintains comprehensive documentation organized into these main sections:

**Automation & Triggers**: Auth monitoring, cron jobs, webhooks, polls, hooks, and Gmail PubSub integration for triggering agent actions.

**Communication Channels**: Support for 25+ platforms including Discord, Slack, Telegram, WhatsApp, Matrix, Signal, IRC, Twitch, and specialized services like Feishu, Zalo, and Nostr.

**CLI Tools**: 50+ command-line utilities covering agent management, configuration, logging, monitoring, and system operations.

**Core Concepts**: Agent runtime, memory systems, session management, multi-agent routing, model failover, streaming, and context handling.

**Gateway Administration**: Authentication, sandboxing, configuration, health checks, discovery protocols, remote access, and security frameworks.

**Installation Methods**: Docker, Kubernetes (via Fly.io, Railway, Render), Ansible, Nix, macOS VMs, and cloud platforms (GCP, Hetzner, Northflank).

**Platform Support**: Native apps for iOS, Android, Linux, Windows (WSL2), and macOS with specialized features like voice wake, camera capture, and location services.

**Tools & Extensions**: Browser automation, code execution, LLM task chains, plugin systems, skills, and the Lobster workflow runtime.

## API Capabilities

**OpenAI Compatibility**: Yes—OpenClaw provides an "OpenAI Chat Completions" compatible HTTP API endpoint, enabling drop-in integration with OpenAI-compatible clients.

**Additional Endpoints**: The platform also exposes a dedicated "Tools Invoke HTTP API" for programmatic tool execution and includes an OpenAPI specification available at the standard endpoint location.

**Automation & Triggers**: Auth monitoring, cron jobs, webhooks, polls, hooks, and Gmail PubSub integration for triggering agent actions.

**Communication Channels**: Support for 25+ platforms including Discord, Slack, Telegram, WhatsApp, Matrix, Signal, IRC, Twitch, and specialized services like Feishu, Zalo, and Nostr.

content.content:
# OpenClaw OpenAI-Compatible API Summary

**Base URL & Port:**
The endpoint is located at `http://<gateway-host>:<port>/v1/chat/completions`, where the port matches the Gateway's standard port that handles "WS + HTTP multiplex."

**Authentication:**
The API uses bearer token authentication. According to the documentation, you should "Send a bearer token: `Authorization: Bearer <token>`". The specific token value depends on your Gateway's auth mode configuration.

**Available Endpoints:**
Currently, only one endpoint is documented:
- `POST /v1/chat/completions` — This endpoint is "disabled by default" and must be explicitly enabled via configuration.

**Key Details:**
- The endpoint executes requests as standard Gateway agent runs
- Agent selection uses the `model` field (e.g., `"openclaw:main"`) or the `x-openclaw-agent-id` header
- It supports both non-streaming and Server-Sent Events (SSE) streaming modes
- Sessions are stateless by default but can be made persistent using the `user` field

content.thinking: The sed approach with multiline didn't work as expected. Let me use Python to do the insertion in all locale files at once, since Python handles multi-line replacement more reliably.

content.text: The multiline sed didn't work. Let me use Python to insert the OpenClaw locale entry in all 8 remaining locale files:

input.command:
python3 -c "
import os

locales = ['es', 'fr', 'ja', 'ko', 'ru', 'vi', 'zh-Hans', 'zh-Hant']
insert_after = '        title: Comet API\n      cerebras:'
insert_text = '        title: Comet API\n      openclaw:\n        description: Self-hosted OpenClaw gateway (OpenAI-compatible)\n        title: OpenClaw\n      cerebras:'

for lang in locales:
    path = f'/home/gem/project/packages/i18n/src/locales/{lang}/settings.yaml'
    with open(path, 'r') as f:
        content = f.read()
    if 'openclaw:' in content:
        print(f'{lang}: already has openclaw, skipping')
        continue
    new_content = content.replace(insert_after, insert_text, 1)
    if new_content == content:
        print(f'{lang}: WARNING - no replacement made')
    else:
        with open(path, 'w') as f:
            f.write(new_content)
        print(f'{lang}: updated')
"

## Summary
- Add `openclaw` provider under `packages/stage-ui/src/libs/providers/providers/openclaw/`
- Connects to a self-hosted OpenClaw gateway via its OpenAI-compatible chat completions API (`POST /v1/chat/completions`)
- Accepts configurable gateway URL (default: `http://localhost:3000/v1`) and optional bearer auth token
- Registered in provider index; locale entries added for all 9 supported languages

## Key Details
- OpenClaw exposes an OpenAI-compatible HTTP API, so the provider reuses `createOpenAI()` from `@xsai-ext/providers/create`
- Validation checks: `connectivity` + `chat_completions` (skips `model_list` since the gateway routes by agent ID, not a traditional model catalog)
- `validationRequiredWhen` always returns `true` since the gateway URL is always needed (auth token is optional)

## Test plan
- [ ] Navigate to Settings → Providers and verify "OpenClaw" appears in the provider list
- [ ] Add an OpenClaw provider config with a running local OpenClaw gateway URL and confirm validation passes
- [ ] Send a chat message through the OpenClaw provider and verify it streams correctly

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

# AIRI Project Memory

## Provider System (packages/stage-ui/src/libs/providers/)
- Providers defined via `defineProvider<T>()` in `providers/registry.ts`
- Each provider = one file in `providers/providers/<name>/index.ts` + one import in `providers/index.ts`
- Uses `createOpenAI()` from `@xsai-ext/providers/create` for OpenAI-compatible APIs
- Validators: `createOpenAICompatibleValidators({ checks: ['connectivity', 'model_list', 'chat_completions'] })`
- Icons use Iconify format: `i-lobe-icons:<name>` or `i-ph:<name>`

## i18n / Locale Files
- Location: `packages/i18n/src/locales/<lang>/settings.yaml` (9 languages: en, es, fr, ja, ko, ru, vi, zh-Hans, zh-Hant)
- Provider locale keys: `settings.pages.providers.provider.<id>.title` and `.description`
- New provider entries go under `settings > pages > providers > provider` YAML section

## Commit Style
- Conventional commits: `feat(package-name): description`
- Scope matches package directory name (e.g., `stage-ui`, `plugin-sdk`, `i18n`)
